headline: Why Oil and Gas Stocks Rallied on Thursday
summary: The cross-industry gains reflected higher oil prices, which were up 3.4% on the day to $64.60 per barrel at that time.  Oil prices have been on a downward trajectory amid the threat of tariffs and their effect on the global economy; however, last night, the Trump administration put fresh sanctions on Iran, as part of its negotiations with the country over its nuclear program.  As Iran is a major oil and gas producer, new sanctions could cut off that supply and raise prices globally.
